content.description: The first problem put up on the bloc ! On the right arete of the front face of the boulder on the right side low down there is a crescent crimp, this is your start right hand with your left on a crimp on the other side of the arete slightly higher. Move directly up the arete using cool knobs and crimps to the glorious topout jug. This one may be pretty stiff ... time will tell.
content.location: Right side of front face. reference beta pic ... it is the green line.

content.description: A perfect moderate for those who can't fathom the heinous crimps and drop knees of "La Femme Fatale" !! This climb is so awesome though with a real punchy start that requires explosive power ! The rest requires pure grit to stay on, groveling all the way to the Hail Mary juggy pinch. The only drawback to this boulder is that the smaller boulder to left poses quite the dab potential which can be very frustrating. In order to avoid the frustration I opted for a more compression / direct version which might be a grade harder and certainly more contrived (I do however recommend trying to stay purely on the front face because it is mega fun) . But several people have now repeated it and it seems the way that I thought would be ultra dabby works relatively well and definitely is easier but doesn't take away any of the fun !! The climb is SDS with left hand on arete and right hand on meaty pinch , go straight up !

Start on two crimps low on the center of the face: a small left pocket looking hold and a right dish below the main crimp rail. Move straight up the face using the middle holds of La Femme Fatale, doing a tricky foot move to match the sloper in the middle. Grab the left arete and finish directly up. The left arete is on.The direct version (without the left arete for a starting toehook or finishing hand) is a little bit harder. I didn't manage to send it, but it probably goes around v8ish.

Mega line of the boulder !! This thing has it all !! Pinches/crimps/slopers/tech/thug/trials/tribulations ... wow so cool. This has got to be one of the best problems of the grade in all of RVA. SDS the same as "Trainspotting" and once you gain the first hold start trending to the right to finish on the top of the right arete. Multiple cruxes with a heartbreaking toss at the very end !
content.location: Same start as "Trainspotting" then trending right.

climbs.name: I Awoke and Found Me Here on the Cold Hill's Side

content.description: Short and sweet with a spicy little topout to make it all the more worth it ! SDS on the crescent juggy edge and then toss up to the good crimps then trending left to top out on the jugs at the top of the arete. Be sure your spotter is engaged cuz the hill requires some extra attention but only just adds to the character of the boulder.
content.location: Around the side of the main face this side of the boulder heads up the hill , reference beta pic.

content.description: At first I think it is easy to walk right by this towards the main face of "Whileaway Boulder" but upon further inspection this thing has some seriously intriguing holds and aesthetics ! If you thought "I Awoke and Found Me Here on the Cold Hill's Side" had a steep landing think again !! Get ready to spot like you're on the Grand Teton. It starts with your hands on the flat shelf in the mouth between the two portions of the boulder and heads straight up the bulge. Short climbers will definitely find this substantially harder so feel free to add a point or two. Also it is certainly possible to create an extension by starting the same as "IAAFMHOTCHS". Oh yeah and the top out requires you to pull out your classic mantel skills.
content.location: Final right line of the boulder

content.description:
A great addition to the RVA circuit ! Whileaway sits right off of the trail and is partially visible if you look hard enough . Once you get down into the basin this boulder will really get you psyched with a really awesome face that has some techy spicy climbs ! The real test piece is "La Femme Fatale" but the other climbs are well worth the visit. Expect on some of the side boulders to have to negotiate an engaging steep hill which creates pad management chaos muahahaha !! Its actually pretty awesome, because when you are topping out "CHOMP CHOMP" you really feel like you are on quite the highball (but completely safe) ! Anyway come and enjoy !   

  P.S. Its hard for me to believe that no one has been on this boulder just because of how good it is ... so if any intel comes in , I am happy to change whatever to make it correct.
